title: How to Construct a Regular Heptagon

steps.headline: Draw an arbitrary circle, centred at a point X{\displaystyle X}.
steps.description: Keep in mind that you will need some extra space around the circle for construction lines.

steps.headline: Draw a circle with radius AX{\displaystyle AX}, centred at A{\displaystyle A}.
steps.description: This circle intersects the first circle at points B{\displaystyle B} and C{\displaystyle C}.

steps.headline: Connect B{\displaystyle B} and C{\displaystyle C}.
steps.description: BC{\displaystyle BC} bisects AX{\displaystyle AX} in E{\displaystyle E}.

steps.headline: Draw a third circle with radius BE{\displaystyle BE}, centred at B{\displaystyle B}.
steps.description: This circle intersects circle a in D{\displaystyle D}.

steps.headline: Use your compass to trace the distance BD around the circle.
steps.description: You should end up exactly where you started. There is an error of about .2% for this method, which is negligible for any heptagon that fits on a regular A4 piece of paper. If you don't end up exactly where you started, there were probably some inaccuracies with the construction tools (e.g. the thickness of the pencil).

steps.headline: Erase the construction lines if needed.
